div1.p: Harrison seeks artifacts of Walter Reed for the Vanderbilt University Medical Department.

div1.head: Letter from William G. Harrison to Emilie Lawrence Reed, August 10, 1929
div1.opener:
VANDERBILT UNIVERSITY
SCOOOL OF MEDICINE
NASHVILLE, TENNESSEE
August 10, 1929. Birmingham, Ala.
WILLIAM GROCE HARRISON, M.D.
LECTURER IN HISTORY OF MEDICINE
Mrs. Walter Reed,
Burlington, Wash.
My dear Mrs. Reed:
div1.p:
The faculty and friends of the Medical Department
of Vanderbilt University are endeavoring to procure choice
souvenirs, illustrating the development and advancement of
medicine in the South. We especially desire to procure
photographs, autographed letters, books, articles of wearing
apparel and articles of furniture that are known to have
been used by medical men who have contributed to the ad-
vancement of medical science and medical service in a large
way.

The writer recently called on Dr. J. R. Keane, at
the Army Medical Museum, seeking his assistance in procuring
these articles for our museum, and it was he who gave me
your address and advised that I write you direct. I hope
you will not feel that this letter is in any sense an im-
position or an impertinence and that you may be able to give
Vanderbilt University something as a permanent memorial of
the work done by your husband in connection with the studies
in yellow fever. The faculty of the medical school will
very greatly appreciate your assistance.
Hoping to hear from you at an early date, I am
div1.closer:
Cordially yours, W.G. Harrison WGH:P
904 Empire Bldg
Bham Ala
Tice Oct.
